intro: Dysodiopsis tagetoides, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features yellow-orange ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, giving it a striking appearance. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Dysodiopsis tagetoides is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate saline soils.
